alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 8:54AM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River near Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and additional minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...The Platte River near Darr and for locations along the river from the Dawson-Lincoln county line to areas downstream near Lexington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, flooding of the low-lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet this evening. This is due to significant recent precipitation upstream in Colorado. Elevated water levels will continue to slowly work their way east along the Platte River in Nebraska. Water levels are expected to fall just below flood stage Friday or Saturday, then begin rising again late in the weekend. It will then rise to 10.7 feet Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 07/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
